extendedIngredients.name: ahi tuna steaks
extendedIngredients.original: 4 tuna steaks, about 1 inch thick (about 2 lbs in all)
extendedIngredients.originalName: tuna steaks, about 1 inch thick (about 2 lbs in all)

extendedIngredients.name: fish
extendedIngredients.original: I would simply grill the fish. I chose pole-caught Canadian Albacore because it is a Seafood Watch Best Choice for tuna.
extendedIngredients.originalName: I would simply grill the fish. I chose pole-caught Canadian A acore because it is a Seafood Watch Best Choice for tuna

extendedIngredients.name: low fat mayo
extendedIngredients.original: Sure enough. Low and behold, I had heard her right! A mint sauce I could love. I was ecstatic.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Sure enough. Low and behold, I had heard her right! A mint sauce I could love. I was ecstatic

extendedIngredients.name: malt vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: I added 3/4-cup malt vinegar, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Let the sauce cook for 3 minutes until it reduces some and gets a little syrupy.
extendedIngredients.originalName: I added malt vinegar, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Let the sauce cook for 3 minutes until it reduces some and gets a little syrupy
meta: for 3 minutes until it reduces some and gets a little syrupy.

extendedIngredients.name: mint
extendedIngredients.original: I then poured the mixture over the mint and let it sit for 15 minutes.
extendedIngredients.originalName: I then poured the mixture over the mint and let it sit for 15 minutes

title: Tuna With Savory Mint Sauce
summary: Tuna With Savory Mint Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1 and costs $37.16 per serving. Watching your figure? This pescatarian recipe has 2118 calories, 301g of protein, and 69g of fat per serving. A mixture of sure enough. low and behold, serious fun food, malt vinegar, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the low fat milk you could follow this main course with the Salted Caramel Brownie Milkshake as a dessert. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. It is brought to you by SippitySup. With a spoonacular score of 76%, this dish is good. Similar recipes are Tuna with Savory Mint Sauce, Grilled Lamb Chops with Peppercorns and Savory Mint Sauce, and Tuna Steaks With Mint Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Raymond R Collection Merlot with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Raymond R Collection Merlot
productMatches.description: The Merlot fills the mouth with smooth cherry, raspberry and plum flavors along with hints of earth and spice in the toasty vanilla finish. Full-bodied, yet approachable, with a good balance of acid and tannins. Pair with anything from grilled salmon, pork tenderloin, barbequed chicken and ribs to Thai red curry or Moroccan tagine.
